an4.60:1.1: Then the householder Anāthapiṇḍika went up to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side. The Buddha said to him:
an4.60:2.1: “Householder, when a noble disciple does four things they are practicing appropriately for a layperson, which brings fame and leads to heaven.
an4.60:2.3: It’s when a noble disciple serves the mendicant Saṅgha with robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.
an4.60:2.4: When a noble disciple does these four things they are practicing appropriately for a layperson, which brings fame and leads to heaven.
an4.60:3.1: Those who are astute practice the way
an4.60:3.3: They provide those who are ethical
an4.60:3.4: and on the right path with robes,
an4.60:4.5: They pass on to a place in heaven,
